text.key: （外を出歩ける服に着替えさせよう…。[p]
text.en-US: (Let's get her dressed to go outside...[p]

text.key: 今日のご夕食は外でですか？[p]
text.en-US: Are we going out for dinner today?[p]

text.key: はい、わかりました。楽しみです。[p]
text.en-US: All right, I understand. I'm looking forward to it.[p]

text.key: …。[lr]私も、ですか？[p]
text.en-US: ...[lr] Am I coming along as well?[p]

text.key: わかりました。[lr]
text.en-US: I understand.[lr]

text.key: あまり重い荷物とかは持てないと思いますけど、ご一緒します…。[p]
text.en-US: I cannot carry many heavy things, but I will accompany you...[p]

text.key: また、ご一緒して良いのですか？[p]
text.en-US: Is it fine for me to accompany you again?[p]

text.key: お出かけですか。[lr]はい、ではご一緒させてもらいます。[p]
text.en-US: Are you going out again?[lr] Then, please allow me to accompany you.[p]

text.key: はい、お出かけですか。[lr]…楽しみです。[p]
text.en-US: Are you going out again?[lr] ...I'm looking forward to it.[p]

text.key: はい。ご一緒します。[lr]
text.en-US: Yes, I will go with you.[lr]

text.key: [name]と一緒なら、どこにいても楽しいですから。[p]
text.en-US: If I am together with [name], anywhere is fine.[p]

text.key: はい、ご一緒させてください。[lr]どこへ行くときだって、おそばに…。[p]
text.en-US: Yes, please allow me to accompany you.[lr] Wherever you go, I will always be with you...[p]

text.key: どこに行こうか？[l]
text.en-US: Where should we go?[l]

text.key: 街に来たが、どこへ行こう。[l]
text.en-US: We've arrived in town, but where should we go next?[l]

text.key: （生活に必要なものだけ買って今日は帰ろう…。[p]
text.en-US: (I'll just buy some necessities and go home for today...[p]

text.key: （手を頭に持って行きシルヴィの柔らかな髪を撫で付ける。[p]
text.en-US: (Leaving my hand on her head I continue to stroke Sylvie's soft hair.[p]

text.key: （手を頬に滑らせシルヴィの暖かな頬に触れる。[p]
text.en-US: (Moving my hand downward, I touch the warm skin of her cheek.[p]

text.key: ん…[p]
（シルヴィの唇にそっと指を押し込むと、彼女は何も言わずその指をしゃぶり始めた[p]
text.en-US: (As I softly press my finger against Sylvie's lips, she begins sucking on it without saying a word.[p]

text.key: （シルヴィは頬に添えた手をそっと掴むと位置をずらして指をしゃぶり始めた[p]
text.en-US: (Sylvie gently grasps the hand on her cheek and shifts its position, beginning to suck on my finger.[p]

text.key: またのご来店をお待ちしていますわ。
text.en-US: I shall await your next visit with bated breath.

text.key: [lr]フフフっ…。
text.en-US: [lr]Hehehe...!

text.key: …せっかくだ、もう少し見ていこうか…[l]
text.en-US: ...I've come all the way here, so I may as well look around some more...[l]

text.key: …おはようございます、[name][p]
text.en-US: ...Good morning, [name].[p]

text.key: その、昨日はごめんなさい。[lr]
text.en-US: Um, I apologize for yesterday.[lr]

text.key: お酒のせいだと思うんですけどなんだか気が緩んでしまったみたいで…。[p]
text.en-US: I think it was the alcohol, but my attitude seemed to slip quite a bit...[p]

text.key: 昨日は…その…[lr]気持ちよすぎて…[p]いつの間にか意識が飛んじゃってたみたいです。[p]
text.en-US: Last night... Um... [lr]It felt too good, and...[p]It seems like I passed out without knowing it.[p]

text.key: 気がついたら、もう朝で…。[lr]すいません。[p]
text.en-US: When I woke up it was already morning... [lr]I'm sorry.[p]

text.key: 昨日は、その…勝手なことをして、ごめんなさい。[lr]
text.en-US: Yesterday, um... I'm sorry for doing something so selfish.[lr]

text.key: 自分で自分が抑えられなくて…。[p]
text.en-US: I couldn't hold myself back anymore...[p]

text.key: でも、昨日の[name]凄かった…♡[p]
text.en-US: But you were amazing last night, [name]...♡[p]

text.key: 正確には覚えてないんですけど…[r]
text.en-US: I don't remember exactly, but... [r]

text.key: たくさん…していただいたんですよね。[p]
text.en-US: We... did it a lot, right?[p]

text.key: …まだ脚に力が入らないんです。[lr]
text.en-US: ...My legs still feel weak.[lr]

text.key: 今日は家で休ませていただいていいでしょうか？[p]
text.en-US: Is it okay for me to rest today?[p]

text.key: …もう、落ち着きました。[lr]
text.en-US: ...I've calmed down.[lr]

text.key: 改めておはようございます。[p]
text.en-US: Again, good morning.[p]

text.key: もうお昼近いですね。[lr]
text.en-US: It's almost after noon, huh?[lr]

text.key: [name]が朝からあんなにするから…。[p]
text.en-US: It's all because [name] was so feisty so early in the morning...[p]

text.key: …嫌ではないですけど。[p]
text.en-US: ...I didn't dislike it though.[p]

text.key: 昨日は家まで運んでくれて、ありがとうございました。[p]
text.en-US: Thank you for carrying me home yesterday.[p]

text.key: しかも私、帰りに疲れて寝ちゃったみたいで…。[lr]
text.en-US: But it seems like I was tired and fell asleep on the way back...[lr]

text.en-US: please don't hold back, okay?[p]

text.key: あの…実は[name]に隠れて、その…。[lr]
text.en-US: Um... The truth is, there have been times where I've hid from you, [name], and um... [lr]

text.key: 自分を慰めたことがあるんです。[p]
text.en-US: "comforted" myself.[p]

text.key: でも、全然満足できなくて、[lr]
text.en-US: But it wasn't enough at all, [lr]

text.key: 余計辛くなってしまって…。[lr]
text.en-US: and just became harder to bear...[lr]

text.key: もう、[name]にしていただかないとダメみたいです…。[p]
text.en-US: I can't bear it anymore unless you do it, [name]...[p]

text.key: [name]…。[p]
text.en-US: [name]...[p]

text.key: （シルヴィが正面から抱きついてきた。[p]
text.en-US: (Sylvie hugs me from the front.[p]

text.key: [name]…。[name]…。[p]
text.en-US: [name]... [name]...[p]

text.key: （繰り返しこちらを呼ぶばかりだが[r]
text.en-US: (She just keeps calling out my name, [r]

text.key: 潤んだ瞳は何かを訴えるようにこちらを見上げている。[p]
text.en-US: but she looks up at me with teary eyes, as if she's trying to tell me something.[p]

text.key: 外に出ると人の目を引いてしまうのは、やっぱりこの痕のせいですよね…[p]
text.en-US: The fact that I draw peoples' attention when I go outside must be because of these scars...[p]

text.key: でも[name]さえ気にしないでくれるなら私は大丈夫です。[p]
text.en-US: But as long as you don't mind them, [name], I'm completely fine.[p]

text.key: 私にとっては[name]が全てですから。[p]
text.en-US: To me, you are everything, [name].[p]

text.key: 自分でも、自分がいやらしいって思います…。[p]
text.en-US: Even I think that I'm lewd...[p]

text.key: …[name]はそんな娘は嫌でしょうか？[r]
text.en-US: ...Do you hate that kind of girl, [name]?[r]

text.key: やっぱり迷惑でしょうか…？[p]
text.en-US: As I thought, is it a bother...?[p]

text.key: いやらしい気持ちになっちゃうのは[name]のことを考えてる間だけなんです…。[p]
text.en-US: I only feel horny when I'm thinking of you, [name]...[p]

text.key: でも、そばにいると考えちゃうし、そばにいないと不安になるし…。[p]
text.en-US: But when you're nearby I get lost in thought, and when you're away I get anxious...[p]

text.key: 自分で体を動かすより、[name]に好きにされてる時の方が自然に思えてしまって。[p]
text.en-US: Rather than moving my body, it feels a lot more natural when you do whatever you want to me, [name].[p]

text.key: 私の体、もう[name]の物になってしまったみたいです…。[p]
text.en-US: It seems like my body has already become yours, [name]...[p]

text.key: [name]に激しくされると、私は[name]の物なんだって感じます。[p]
text.en-US: When you do me roughly, [name], I feel like I have become yours.[p]

text.key: それがどうしようもなく嬉しく感じるのは、やっぱり変なんでしょうね…。[p]
text.en-US: I wonder if it's weird that I feel so unbelievably happy when I think that...[p]

text.key: たとえ他に生きていく居場所があったとしても、[r]
text.en-US: Even if there happened to be somewhere else I could live, [r]

text.key: 私もう[name]と一緒じゃないとダメです。[p]
text.en-US: I can't live unless I'm together with you, [name].[p]

text.key: ずっと一緒にいてください。ずっと…ずっと…。[p]
text.en-US: Please be with me always. Always... Always...[p]

text.key: [name]のそばにいるだけで嬉しくて、[name]に触れてると幸せです。[p]
text.en-US: Just by being near you, [name], I feel so happy. When you touch me, I feel even happier.[p]

text.key: [name]はどんな女性が好みなんでしょう？[p]
text.en-US: What kind of girl is your type, [name]?[p]

text.key: 言葉使い、姿勢、振る舞い[r]
text.en-US: Manner of speech, attitude, behavior... [r]

text.key: 私、どう変わればもっと好きになってもらえますか？[p]
text.en-US: What should I change to get you to like me more?[p]

text.key: （普段シルヴィと入る喫茶店に入った。[lr]
text.en-US: (I entered the cafe I normally go to with Sylvie.[lr]

text.key: 何か土産を買っていこうか。[p]
text.en-US: Maybe I should bring her home something.[p]

text.key: いらっしゃいませー？[p]
text.en-US: Welcome～![p]

text.key: 今日はお一人様ですかー？[lr]
text.en-US: You're on your own today?[lr]

text.key: お持ち帰りですかそうですかー。[p]
text.en-US: You're taking it home, I see～![p]

text.key: おやおやー？今日はお一人様ですかー？[lr]
text.en-US: Oho? You're on your own today?[lr]

text.key: お持ち帰り用の品もいろいろありますよー？[p]
text.en-US: We have plenty of foods you can take with you![p]

text.key: （何を買おうか？[p]
text.en-US: (What should I buy?[p]

text.key: あの小さなお連れさんとはよくいらっしゃいますねー？[p]
text.en-US: You come here often with that li'l companion of yours, huh?[p]

text.key: お名前なんでしたっけー？そもそも伺ってましたっけー？[lr]
text.en-US: What was her name? Actually, did I ever ask?[lr]

text.key: あ、私の名前って言いましたっけー？[p]
text.en-US: Ah, did I ever tell you my name?[p]

text.key: 私ネフィーと申します。[lr]
text.en-US: My name's Nephy.[lr]

text.key: 今後もぜひ店をご贔屓にお願いしますねー？[p]
text.en-US: Please be sure to continue to patronize us in the future![p]

text.key: （もう見慣れたものだが、いまだに食器の扱い方を見ているとヒヤヒヤする[p]
text.en-US: (I've gotten used to seeing it, but even now I worry watching her handle dishes.[p]

text.key: ご心配無用ですよー？[p]
text.en-US: No need to worry～[p]

text.key: 今まで食器は割ったことも落としたこともありませんのですよー？[p]
text.en-US: I haven't broken a plate or dropped anything even once, you know?[p]

text.key: お客様と小さなお連れさん、ちょっとした噂になってるみたいですねー？[p]
text.en-US: You and your li'l companion have become quite the topic around town lately, huh?[p]

text.key: 内容についてですかー？[lr]
text.en-US: You want to know the details?[lr]

text.key: 噂ってのは当事者の前でするものではありませんよー？[p]
text.en-US: Rumors shouldn't be spoken in front of their subject, though～[p]

text.key: （力の抜けたようにフラフラしている割に移動や食器の扱いはやたらと速い。[p]
text.en-US: (Even though she looks frail her movements and handling of plates is recklessly fast.[p]

text.key: 動きが変だとはよく言われるんですけどねー？[lr]
text.en-US: People have told me I move kinda weird before.[lr]

text.key: 治りそうもないんでお許しくださいねー？[p]
text.en-US: I don't think I'll change any time soon so forgive me, 'kay?[p]

text.key: お店のものはお口に合っていますかー？[p]
text.en-US: Was our food to your liking?[p]

text.key: （まずいと思う店に通う客はいないと思うが…。[p]
text.en-US: (I don't think a customer would frequent a place they don't like the food...[p]

text.key: そうですかそうですかー。[r]
text.en-US: I see, I see～![r]

text.key: まぁそうですよねー？[p]
text.en-US: Well, that's pretty true huh?[p]

text.key: …口に合わない店に通う酔狂な人も一度ぐらい見てみたいんですけどねー？[p]
text.en-US: ...Though I'd love to see a whimsical person who'd do that at least once![p]

text.key: （この店が立った頃にもこの店員を見た気はするが、[r]
text.en-US: (I remember seeing this employee around the time the store was built,[r]

text.key: シルヴィと来るまでウェイトレスとして見かけた記憶がない。[p]
text.en-US: But until coming here with Sylvie I don't remember her ever being a waitress.[p]

text.key: ウェイトレス雑用コックに店長、気まぐれ日替わりその日の気分で色々やっているのですよー？[p]
text.en-US: Waitress, odd jobs, cook, manager... My role changes with my mood each day you know?[p]

text.key: 最近はウェイトレスがマイブームですねー？[p]
text.en-US: Lately this waitress thing has become a bit of a habit![p]

text.key: そういえばお客様の小さなお連れさんー？[lr]
text.en-US: Speaking of, that li'l companion of yours...[lr]

text.key: ここら辺では珍しい服をお召しになっていますよねー？[p]
text.en-US: She wears clothes that are rather rare for the area doesn't she?[p]

text.key: もしかして金髪長身の女性から買ってますー？[p]
text.en-US: Could it be you bought them from the tall blonde lady?[p]

text.key: （あの店でほかの客を見たことはないが、[r]
text.en-US: (I've never seen any other customers in that store,[r]

text.key: 少なくともネフィーは店を知っているようだ。[p]
text.en-US: But it appears Nephy is at least aware of its existence.[p]

text.key: やっぱりそうでしたかー。[lr]
text.en-US: I knew that had to be it![lr]

text.key: いえいえ深い意味はないんですけどねー。[p]
text.en-US: Nah, nah, I didn't have any particular reason for bringing it up.[p]

text.key: （危なっかしい動きや間の抜けたような喋り方が目立つが、[r]
text.en-US: (Her risky movements and airheaded speech make her stand out,[r]

text.key: あまり痛い目には合いそうにない印象を受ける。[p]
text.en-US: But it doesn't seem like she's in any danger of meeting an unfortunate fate.[p]

text.key: （案外世渡りがうまいのかもしれない。[p]
text.en-US: (In fact, she might be doing quite well for herself.[p]

text.key: 何か買っていきますかー？[lr]
text.en-US: Are you gonna buy something to go?[lr]

text.key: 今日も活きのいいのが入ってますよー？[p]
text.en-US: We've got some real fresh goods today too![p]

text.key: （マイペースが過ぎるだけかもしれない…。[p]
text.en-US: (She may simply be too caught up in her own pace...[p]

text.key: ご存知の通り無駄もミスもないパーフェクトウェイトレスでございます。[lr]
text.en-US: As you know, I am a perfect waitress without mistakes or excess.[lr]

text.key: 安心してご注文をどうぞー？[p]
text.en-US: Go ahead and order without worry![p]

text.key: （実際の仕事ぶりをご存知でない客は大半が不安を抱えて注文をしていることだろう…。[p]
text.en-US: (I wonder if she means that those who don't know her work ethic order worriedly...[p]

text.key: メニューには喫茶向けのものしかありませんけど[r]
text.en-US: Our menu contains only foods that go well with tea,[r]

text.key: 私お料理は大抵のものが作れるんですよー？[p]
text.en-US: But I can cook just about anything, you know?[p]

text.key: カレーでもスシでも作れますよー？[lr]
text.en-US: I can even make curry and sushi![lr]

text.key: あ、カレーとスシ知ってます？[p]
text.en-US: Ah, do you know what curry and sushi are?[p]

text.key: （喫茶店向けではないからメニューにないのでは…[p]
text.en-US: (I thought they weren't part of the menu because they weren't cafe fare...?[p]

text.key: まぁ材料ないからいきなり頼まれても出せないんですけどねー？[p]
text.en-US: Well I don't have the ingredients so even if you asked I couldn't make it, hehe.[p]

text.key: メニューには喫茶向けのものしかありませんがお料理は大抵のものが作れるんですよー？[p]
text.en-US: Our menu contains only foods that go well with tea, but I can cook just about anything, you know?[p]

text.key: 今度ピザ作りとかお披露目しましょうかー？ピザ作り[p]
text.en-US: Should I introduce pizza-making to our repertoire? Pizza-making![p]

text.key: （ウェイトレスの一存でそんなパフォーマンスをしてもいいのだろうか…。[p]
text.en-US: (I wonder if it would be okay for a waitress to give such a performance...[p]

text.key: ヒザ蹴りのパフォーマンスをしてもいいですよー？ヒザ蹴り。[p]
text.en-US: I could do a knee strike performance for you if you want. A knee strike.[p]

text.key: （…意味がわからない[p]
text.en-US: (...That makes no sense.[p]

text.key: （それにしても一人だけやたら浮いた服装をしている。[p]
text.en-US: (Still, odd that only one employee here wears such a haphazardly-assembled outfit.[p]

text.key: 服ですかー？ちゃんとお仕事用の服ですよー？[p]
text.en-US: My clothes? These are proper work clothes, you know?[p]

text.key: （まさか彼女専用の制服なのだろうか。[p]
text.en-US: (Could it be they're a uniform made specifically for her?[p]

text.key: お仕事用の私服ですねー[p]
text.en-US: They're my personal wardrobe for working![p]

text.key: （[miyage]を買った。[p]
text.en-US: (I bought the [miyage].[p]

text.key: [miyage]でございますねー？[lr]
text.en-US: You would like the [miyage], correct?[lr]

text.key: お買い上げありがとうございましたー。[p]
text.en-US: Thank you very much for your purchase![p]

text.key: （さて、家に帰ろう…[p]
text.en-US: (Well then, I'd better get back home...[p]

text.key: （買い物をしているとどこかで見たような背中が見えた。[l]
text.en-US: (While shopping I noticed the back of a man which looked quite familiar.[l]

text.key: （先に買い物を済ませよう…。[p]
text.en-US: (Let's finish shopping first...[p]

text.key: おや先生、お買い物ですか。[p]
text.en-US: Well if it isn't the good doctor. Out shopping?[p]

text.key: うちでも何か見ていきますか？[p]
text.en-US: Would you perhaps be interested in one of my wares?[p]

text.key: （前に買ったのがまだ家に残っていたはずだ…。[p]
text.en-US: (I'm pretty sure the one I bought before is still at home...[p]

text.key: 了解しました。ではこちらを。[p]
text.en-US: Most certainly. Right this way, then.[p]

text.key: （梅酒を買った。[p]
text.en-US: (I bought a bottle of plum wine.[p]

text.key: では機会がありましたらまた。[p]
text.en-US: Well then, until the next time our paths cross.[p]

text.key: ここはいい街ですね。[lr]
text.en-US: This is a wonderful little town, isn't it?[lr]

text.key: ちょいと変わったところもあるが基本的に平和だ。[p]
text.en-US: Certainly it's got its quirks, but it's basically peaceful.[p]

text.key: …変わったところですか？[lr]
text.en-US: ...The quirks, you ask?[lr]

text.key: そりゃあ底抜けにお人好しな医者がいるのなんかは良い一例じゃないですかね。[p]
text.en-US: The existence of an unfathomably gullible doctor is one good example, is it not?[p]

text.key: 前にも申し上げたかと思いますが私の商売は扱う商品の幅広さが売りです。[lr]
text.en-US: I believe I mentioned this before, but my business excels in its sheer variety of products.[lr]

text.key: 異国のものや変わったものを取り扱うことがメインになるので競争相手が少ない分[r]
text.en-US: My main focus is foreign goods and curiosities which does keep competition down,[r]

text.key: 少ない需要を求めている場所を探し回らないと商売が成立しない。[p]
text.en-US: but it also means if I don't find a place with ample demand for my wares, I can't do business.[p]

text.key: その点この街は大当たりですね。[lr]
text.en-US: In that sense, this city has been a massive boon for me.[lr]

text.key: それなりに金回りのいい豊さがあって、風変わりなものを扱いたがる商売人が多い。[p]
text.en-US: The local economy is strong, and there are many distributors interested in the oddities I have to offer.[p]

text.key: 最近になって変わった商品を扱い始めた店に心当たりがあったらそいつは十中八九私の商売相手ですね。[lr]
text.en-US: Lately if you have even a suspicion about a shop selling strange things, most likely they are indeed my customers.[lr]

text.key: 先生のお気に召したら是非贔屓してやってください。[p]
text.en-US: If there's ever anything I may be able to provide, please do send your business my way.[p]

text.key: ここは平和な街に見えますね。[lr]
text.en-US: This town appears to be quite peaceful.[lr]

text.key: ただ、不気味に平和すぎるところも含めて変わった部分も多いようですが…。[p]
text.en-US: It's just that it's almost eerily peaceful, which isn't helped by the more...queer bits, shall we say.[p]

text.key: それなりに治安が安定した落ち着きのある街は商売もあまり変化を求めず[r]
text.en-US: Normally a town with peace and public order would mean no place for businesses such as mine,[r]

text.key: 私の出る幕はないのがお決まりだったんですが、どうもこの街は違うようです。[p]
text.en-US: but for some strange reason, this town is an exception to the rule.[p]

text.key: あっちこっち動き回っていたおかげで仕事の人脈はかなり広いほうです。[lr]
text.en-US: Wandering around here, I've found quite a few potentially profitable business connections.[lr]

text.key: 一般的な需要があるかはさておき、とても珍しいものも仕入れることができますね。[p]
text.en-US: With typical commodities aside, there are some truly unique items I could start stocking.[p]

text.key: 人が入れ替わり、金が回り、ものが消費される。[lr]
text.en-US: People change, money exchanges hands, goods are consumed.[lr]

text.key: 騒がしいが市場として正しい景色ですね。[p]
text.en-US: It may be noisy, but a market is truly the place to be.[p]

text.key: 私のこの積荷も、この市に商品として流れるわけだ。[p]
text.en-US: This luggage I'm carrying is wares I'm peddling at this market, you see.[p]

text.key: 私がここで取引してる商品はほとんどが国外からの輸入品ですね。[p]
text.en-US: The items I sell are almost entirely imported for foreign countries.[p]

text.key: 食品、酒、衣服に書物。[lr]
text.en-US: Foodstuffs, alcohol, clothing and even books.[lr]

text.key: 自分で言うのもなんですが、あまり一般向けでない風変わりなものが多い。[p]
text.en-US: It's perhaps not my place to say, but the majority are peculiarities you won't find in common circulation.[p]

text.key: 私から商品を仕入れる商売人がいるってことはさらにそれを買う街の住人がいるわけで。[lr]
text.en-US: The fact that there are distributors here buying my wares means there must also be citizens purchasing these goods from them.[lr]

text.key: 町中酔狂なやつで溢れてるんでしょう。[p]
text.en-US: I wonder if these streets will become awash with rabid drunkenness?[p]

text.key: （少し距離があったので足早に近くへ寄る。[p]
text.en-US: (There was a bit of distance between us, so I jogged up next to him.[p]

text.key: ん？[p]
text.en-US: Hm?[p]

text.key: …おや、先生。[lr]
text.en-US: ...Well, hello doctor.[lr]

text.key: またお会いしましたね。[lr]
text.en-US: So we meet again.[lr]

text.key: わざわざ駈け寄らなくとも声をかけてくれればよかったのに。[p]
text.en-US: Merely calling out to me would have sufficed, there was no need to run my way.[p]

text.key: …あぁ、そういえば結局一度も名乗ってないんでしたね。[lr]
text.en-US: ...Ahh, come to think of it I don't believe I ever gave you my name, did I?[lr]

text.key: 私、名はフェルムと申します。[p]
text.en-US: My name is Ferrum.[p]

text.key: あれきりの縁だと思っていましたし、私に関わってもご迷惑をおかけしかねないと思っていたもので[lr]
text.en-US: There was quite a bit of history between us, not to mention I assumed involving yourself with me would be a bother.[lr]

text.key: 名も告げぬ失礼を重ねてしまい申し訳ありません。[p]
text.en-US: My sincerest apologies for any inconvenience I may have caused by not giving my name before.[p]

text.key: 今までも何度か不定期にこの街での商売を繰り返していたんですが、最近大きな商談がまとまりまして[lr]
text.en-US: I used to come to this town infrequently, but lately a rather lucrative business deal solidified[lr]

text.key: ここらには定期的に足を運ぶことになりました。[p]
text.en-US: so I'll be a much more common sight around these parts from now on.[p]

text.key: これからも先生が市場に足を運ぶなら顔を合わせる機会もあるでしょう。[p]
text.en-US: If you find yourself wandering into the market, doctor, we will likely cross paths again.[p]

text.key: もちろんまっとうな商売です。[lr]
text.en-US: Of course, all of my business is perfectly legal.[lr]

text.key: ご迷惑もをおかけする心配もないでしょう。[p]
text.en-US: I doubt there would be any need to concern yourself with any more...inconveniences.[p]

text.key: さておき先生は買い物ですか。何時ぞやのように何か見てみますか？[p]
text.en-US: Now then, you're shopping, are you not? Might I interest you at a peek at what I have to offer?[p]

text.key: 今回はそうですね…。[lr]
text.en-US: This time, let's have a look...[lr]

text.key: 先生、酒はたしなみますか？[p]
text.en-US: Doctor, do you have a liking for alcohol?[p]

text.key: 異国にある杏子の亜種のような果物を漬けて作った酒でして、現地では梅酒と呼ばれてるものです。[p]
text.en-US: This is a wine made from the fruit of a subspecies of apricot, which in its native land is known as 'plum wine'.[p]

text.key: かなり甘いもんだから強い酒がこのみなら口に合わないかもしれませんが、[r]
text.en-US: It's considerably sweet so if stronger spirits are your preference it may not be for you,[r]

text.key: ジュースみたいなもんだと思えば悪くないですし、酒が苦手でも飲みやすいと思いますよ。[p]
text.en-US: but if you think of it as juice it's really not bad, and even if you don't care for alcohol I believe it's quite easy to drink.[p]

text.key: いかがでしょう？[p]
text.en-US: So, how about it?[p]

text.key: この時間はここにいることも多いはずです。[lr]
text.en-US: You should be able to find me here at this time of day often.[lr]

text.key: 手元に在庫ががあればですが、また声をかけてくださればお売りいたしますよ。[p]
text.en-US: It of course depends on if I have more in stock, but assuming I do I would be more than glad to sell you more.[p]

text.key: そうですか、また気が向いたらお声をかけてください[lr]
text.en-US: I see. If you ever change your mind, do not hesitate to contact me.[lr]

text.key: 手元に在庫ががあればですが、その時には改めてお売りいたしますよ。[p]
text.en-US: It of course depends on if I have more in stock, but assuming I do I would have no problem selling you a bottle at that time.[p]

text.key: あの奴隷から伝言…ですか？[p]
text.en-US: A message to me from that slave...you say?[p]

text.key: …礼を言われるような筋合いはありませんよ。[p]
text.en-US: I have done no such praiseworthy noble deed.[p]

text.key: 私からしたら面倒ごとを他人に押し付けただけです。[lr]
text.en-US: If there's anything I've done, it's foist my problems onto others.[lr]

text.key: 先生だってわかってるでしょう。言ってやらなかったんですか？[p]
text.en-US: Surely you understand, doctor. Did I not say the same when we met again that day?[p]

text.key: （家のことをシルヴィに任せて買い出しに行こう。[p]
text.en-US: (Let's leave Sylvie in charge of the house and go shopping.[p]

text.key: もう日も傾いてますけど、お一人でお買物ですか？[p]
text.en-US: It's quite late, but you're going shopping alone anyway?[p]

text.key: お一人でお買物ですか？[p]
text.en-US: Going shopping on your own?[p]

text.key: はい、行ってらっしゃいませ。お気をつけて。[p]
text.en-US: Okay, have a safe trip. Be careful.[p]

text.key: はい、行ってらっしゃいませ。[lr]
text.en-US: Okay, have a safe trip.[lr]

text.key: お家のことは任せてください。[p]
text.en-US: Please leave the house to me.[p]

text.key: …おかえりをお待ちしてます。[p]
text.en-US: ...I'll be awaiting your return.[p]

text.key: …はい、行ってらっしゃいませ。[lr]
text.en-US: ...Okay, have a safe trip.[lr]

text.key: すぐ、帰ってきますよね。[p]
text.en-US: Please, come home soon, okay?[p]

text.key: …はい、行ってらっしゃいませ。[p]
text.en-US: ...Okay, have a safe trip.[p]

text.key: 大丈夫です、大丈夫…。[p]
text.en-US: It's fine, I'll be fine...[p]

text.key: （必要なものは買い終わった。[lr]
text.en-US: (I finished buying what I needed.[lr]

text.key: ついでにどこかに寄っていこうか？[l]
text.en-US: Should I drop by somewhere while I'm out?[l]

text.key: （寄り道はしないでまっすぐ帰ろう。[p]
text.en-US: (Let's head straight home without any detours.[p]

text.key: あ、おかえりなさい、[name]。[p]
text.en-US: Ah, welcome home, [name].[p]

text.key: お買物はどうでしたか？[p]
text.en-US: How did your shopping trip go?[p]

text.key: おかえりなさい、[name]。[p]

text.key: 帰ってくるのを窓から様子をうかがって待っていたようだ。[p]
text.en-US: It seems that she stayed at the window awaiting my return.[p]

text.key: （家の前に来るとドアが開きシルヴィが駆け寄ってきた。[p]

text.key: あ、えっと…待ちきれなくって…。[p]

text.key: （家のそばまで来るとドアが開きシルヴィが駆け寄ってきた。[p]
text.en-US: (As I turned the corner towards my house, the front door flew open and Sylvie came running out.[p]

text.key: …[name]っ。[p]
（走ってきたシルヴィは立ち止まらずそのまま腕の中に飛び込んできた。[p]
text.en-US: (Sylvie ran up and leapt into my arms without stopping.[p]

text.key: …ぁ。ごめんなさい。[lr]
text.en-US: ...Ah, I'm sorry.[lr]

text.key: 普段はこの時間には服屋は閉まっていたはずだが、明かりがついている。[lr]
text.en-US: Normally at this hour the clothes shop would be closed, but I could see lights on inside.[lr]

text.key: 店をしまい忘れているわけではなさそうだ。[p]
text.en-US: It doesn't appear that they simply forgot to close the store properly.[p]

text.key: 店内の照明や商品が昼とはガラッと変わっている…。[p]
text.en-US: The store's lighting and displayed wares are completely different from during the day...[p]

text.key: あら、いらっしゃいませ[lr]
text.en-US: Oh my, welcome.[lr]

text.key: 本日よりこの時間は昼とは別の商品を並べていますの。[p]
text.en-US: At this time from today forward, I shall provide alternative wares to those displayed during daylight hours.[p]

text.key: 扱っている物は…見ればお分かりですわよね[lr]
text.en-US: The items we have available for purchase... well, I trust you understand merely by their appearance?[lr]

text.key: 昼と同じく基本的に女物しか扱ってませんが、[r]
text.en-US: As with our daytime inventory we have but items designed for the feminine persuasion,[r]

text.key: 「プレゼント」としてお客様の需要に沿ったものをお探しになってはいかがかしら？[p]
text.en-US: so perhaps you could peruse for a special gift in line with your own desires?[p]

text.key: もちろんお客様のご趣味を口外するようなことはございませんわ。[lr]
text.en-US: Of course, I would never dream of disclosing my precious customer's fetishes.[lr]

text.key: 遠慮なくお買い上げなさってくださいませ[lr]

text.en-US: ...Mmm, it's very moist and sweet.[lr]

text.key: プリンアラモード、おいしそう。[lr]
text.en-US: The caramel custard a la mode looks tasty.[lr]

text.key: …プリンの後のフルーツは、ちょっと酸っぱくて、これもおいしい。[p]
text.en-US: ...The fruit after eating the custard tastes slightly sour, but this is tasty too.[p]

text.key: プリンだけだったら飽きちゃいそうな量ですけど、[r]
text.en-US: I might get tired of it if it were just custard, [r]

text.key: クリームやフルーツがあるからずっとおいしいですね。[p]
text.en-US: but it has cream and fruit on it so it's delicious all the way through.[p]

text.key: おっきいプリン…。[lr]色々乗ってて、アラモードっていうんですか？[lr]なんだか豪華な感じがしますね。[p]
text.en-US: Such a big custard... [lr]It has a lot on it. Is it called an a la mode? [lr]I feel slightly luxurious eating something like this.[p]

text.key: その、食べちゃって、いいんですか？[lr]
text.en-US: Um... Is it fine if I eat this?[lr]

text.key: ん、甘くって口の中で、トロってする…。[lr]
text.en-US: Mmm... It's sweet and melting in my mouth...[lr]

text.key: おいしいです。[lr]
text.en-US: It's delicious.[lr]

text.key: クリームやフルーツと一緒に食べると、味が違って、食べてて楽しい。[p]
text.en-US: When you eat fruit and cream together the taste changes and it's fun to eat.[p]

text.key: おっきなパフェ、おいしそう。[lr]
text.en-US: This big parfait looks delicious.[lr]

text.key: んむ…美味しい。[lr]
text.en-US: Om... so good.[lr]

text.key: ケーキとかスポンジ系のデザートとは違う満腹感を感じますね。[p]
text.en-US: It gives you a different satisfaction from cakes or sponge-like desserts.[p]

text.key: 一人じゃ食べきれないし、一人で食べきるのはもったいないです。[lr]
text.en-US: I'd never be able to finish it on my own, and even if I did it'd be a waste.[lr]

text.key: 今回も、手伝ってくださいますよね？[p]
text.en-US: You'll help me out with it again this time, right?[p]

text.key: その…はい、あーん♡[p]
text.en-US: Um... Okay, say aaaaaah~♡[p]

text.key: すごいパフェ、こういうの食べてみるのちょっと憧れてました。[p]
text.en-US: What an amazing parfait, I've always wanted to try eating something like this.[p]

text.key: でもやっぱり大きいですね…。[lr]
text.en-US: But it sure is big...[lr]

text.key: 食べきれるかな…。[p]
text.en-US: I wonder if I can eat the whole thing...?[p]

text.key: あむ…いちごとクリームとジャム？[lr]
text.en-US: Om... Strawberries, cream and jam?[lr]

text.key: あと下の方にもなにかサクサクしたのが入ってます。[lr]
text.en-US: Also there's something crunchy a little deeper.[lr]

text.key: 甘くて美味しいです♡[p]
text.en-US: It's sweet and delicious♡[p]

text.key: …でも、やっぱり一人じゃ食べきれないかもしれません。[lr]
text.en-US: ...But, I don't think I can finish it by myself.[lr]

text.key: [name]も少し、手伝ってくれませんか？[p]
text.en-US: Could you help me eat what's left, [name]?[p]

text.key: ワッフル、美味しそう。[lr]
text.en-US: This waffle looks good.[lr]

text.key: ふふ…いただきますね。[p]
text.en-US: Hehe...I'll have some, okay?[p]

text.key: あむ…美味しい。[lr]
text.en-US: Om...tasty.[lr]

text.key: アイスクリームとチョコソースがかかると、[r]
text.en-US: When you put ice cream and chocolate sauce on top, [r]

text.key: ただのワッフルより見た目も美味しそうに見えますよね。[p]
text.en-US: it looks even tastier than a normal waffle doesn't it?[p]

text.key: ここのお店のワッフルはふわふわでほんのり甘くて、[r]
text.en-US: This cafe's waffles are soft and a little sweet, [r]

text.key: 単体でも十分美味しく食べれそうですけど。[lr]
text.en-US: so even without toppings they'd probably be plenty tasty.[lr]

text.key: チョコソースとアイスも…、んーおいしい。[p]
text.en-US: The chocolate sauce and ice cream... *gulp* Mmm, so good![p]

text.key: ワッフル…知ってはいますけど、こんなに色々乗ってて美味しそうなものでしたっけ？[lr]
text.en-US: Waffles... I know what they are, but were they always something you put so much on top of to make them delicious-looking?[lr]

text.key: 頂いていいんですよね？[p]
text.en-US: It's okay to have some, right?[p]

text.key: いただきます…あむ。[p]
text.en-US: I'll eat now, then... Om.[p]

text.key: ん、生地もケーキとかパンとは違う食感ですね。[p]
text.en-US: Mm, the crust's texture is different from cake or bread.[p]

text.key: ふわふわで、しっとり甘くて…美味しい。[p]
text.en-US: It's soft and dripping with sweetness...yum.[p]

text.key: （シルヴィは幸せそうに顔をほころばせながら食べている。[p]
text.en-US: (Sylvie happily eats with a big smile on her face.[p]

text.key: （食べているシルヴィの表情はいつもより朗らかに感じる。[p]
text.en-US: (Sylvie happily eats with a big smile on her face.[p]

text.key: （シルヴィはぎこちないながらも食べることを楽しんでいるようだ。[p]
text.en-US: (Sylvie seems to enjoy eating her food despite looking awkward.[p]

text.key: ごちそうさまでした。[lr]
text.en-US: Thank you for the meal.[lr]

text.key: とてもおいしかったです。[p]
text.en-US: It was very delicious...[p]

text.key: ありがとうございました。[name]。
text.en-US: Thank you very much, [name].

text.key: （シルヴィとレストランへ来た。[p]
text.en-US: (I came to the restaurant with Sylvie.[p]

text.key: （普段来ている店に入る。[lr]
text.en-US: (We enter the cafe we usually frequent.[lr]

text.key: 夜はメニューが変わってレストランになっているようだ。[p]
text.en-US: It appears this is a restaurant thats menu changes in the evening.[p]

text.key: ふらふらと歩く店員に席へ案内された。[p]
text.en-US: We were guided to our seats by the whimsical waitress.[p]

text.key: （何を注文しようか？[p]
text.en-US: (What should we order?[p]

text.key: スパゲッティ、ソースのいい香りがしておいしそう。[lr]
text.en-US: Spaghetti... The sauce smells delicious.[lr]

text.key: じゃあ、いただきますね。[p]
text.en-US: Well, I'll eat it now.[p]

text.key: ん、おいしいです。[p]
text.en-US: Mm, it's tasty.[p]

text.key: …え、ソースが口元に？[l]
text.en-US: ...Eh, there's sauce on my mouth? [l]

text.key: ん…あれ、逆ですか？[p]
text.en-US: Hm...huh, it's on the other side?[p]

text.key: ん、本当だ。[p]
text.en-US: Mm...ah, so it is.[p]

text.key: えっと…すいません、なんだか恥ずかしい…。[p]
text.en-US: Um... I'm sorry, that's kind of embarrassing...[p]

text.key: パスタ、カルボナーラですね。おいしそうです。[lr]
text.en-US: Pasta... This is 'carbonara', right? It looks yummy.[lr]

text.key: ふふ、おいしいです。[p]
text.en-US: Hehe, it's really good.[p]

text.key: やっぱり、お家で作るものとはなんだか味が違いますね。[lr]
text.en-US: It really does taste different from eating at home.[lr]

text.key: 何が違うんだろう…。[p]
text.en-US: I wonder what makes the difference...[p]

text.key: …[name]のところに来て初めて頂いたご飯も同じようなメニューでしたね。[p]
text.en-US: ...Come to think of it, isn't this the same thing [name] gave me our first night together?[p]

text.key: あれもおいしかったですけど、正直味を楽しむ余裕はあまりなかったですね。[p]
text.en-US: That was delicious, but to be honest I couldn't savor the taste much back then...[p]

text.key: 他のことで頭がいっぱいで…。[p]
text.en-US: I had a lot more things on my mind...[p]

text.key: ハンバーグステーキ、いい匂いがしておいしそうですね。[lr]
text.en-US: The salisbury steak smells really good.[lr]

text.key: じゃあ、頂きます。[p]
text.en-US: Well, thank you for the meal.[p]

text.key: ん〜、お肉なのにふんわり柔らかくっておいしいです。[p]
text.en-US: Mmmm! Even though it's meat it's so soft and delicious![p]

text.key: かかってるソースはこれ…なんだろう。[lr]
text.en-US: This sauce on it...what is it I wonder?[lr]

text.key: 何で作ってあるのか全然わからない…ワインとか野菜とかかな。[p]
text.en-US: I have no idea what it's made from... Wine? Maybe vegetables?[p]

text.key: ステーキ…シンプルだけどすごく食欲をそそりますね。[lr]
text.en-US: A steak... Even though it's so simple it makes your mouth water.[lr]

text.key: ん…おいしいです。[p]
text.en-US: Mm... so tasty.[p]

text.key: 家でただお肉を焼いてもきっとこんなにおいしくならないですよね。[lr]
text.en-US: I'm sure that even if I grilled meat at home it'd never be this delicious.[lr]

text.key: 下ごしらえとかいろいろしてるのかな…。[p]
text.en-US: I wonder what sorts of things they do to prepare it...[p]

text.key: ステーキ…こんなお肉の塊を私が食べてもいいんでしょうか…[p]
text.en-US: A steak... Is it really all right for me to eat all this meat?[p]

text.key: い、いただきます。[p]
text.en-US: W-Well, I'll dig in.[p]

text.key: …あ、ごめんなさい、とてもおいしいです。[lr]
text.en-US: ...Ah, I'm sorry, it's just so delicious.[lr]

text.key: 孤児で奴隷だった私がこんなものを口にする日が来るなんて考えた事もなくて、[r]ちょっと言葉を失ってました…。[p]
text.en-US: The thought that an orphan and slave like myself would one day taste something like this [r]had never crossed my mind, so I'm at a loss for words...[p]

text.key: 私あんまり食べるの早くないから、ちょっと急いで食べますね。[lr]
text.en-US: I'm not a fast eater, but I'll try to be a little faster this time.[lr]

text.key: あったかいうちに食べないともったいないです。[p]
text.en-US: It would be a waste not to eat it while it's still hot after all.[p]

text.key: ロールキャベツ、美味しそうです。[p]
text.en-US: The stuffed cabbage is delicious.[p]

text.key: じゃあ、頂きますね。[p]
text.en-US: Well, I'll dig in, then.[p]

text.key: ん、美味しいです。[p]
text.en-US: Mmm, it's delicious.[p]

text.key: キャベツとお肉にスープが染み込んでるから[r]
text.en-US: Because the meat and soup permeate the cabbage [r]

text.key: みずみずしくて、野菜の味がして、[lr]
text.en-US: it's both hearty and leafy...[lr]

text.key: お肉料理なのに食べてて重さをあんまり感じませんね。[p]
text.en-US: Even though it's a meat dish it doesn't seem overly filling.[p]

text.key: すごくいい匂い…ロールキャベツ、ですか？[lr]
text.en-US: What a delicious smell... This is stuffed cabbage?[lr]

text.key: はい、食べた事はないですね[p]
text.en-US: No, I've never eaten them before.[p]

text.key: キャベツで…あ、お肉が包んであるんですね。[lr]
text.en-US: It's cabbage... Ah! There's meat rolled inside it![lr]

text.key: トマトのスープで煮込んであるのかな？[p]
text.en-US: Is it boiled in tomato soup too?[p]

text.key: あむ…[p]
text.en-US: Nom...[p]

text.key: ん、おいしい…[p]
text.en-US: Mmm, tasty...[p]

text.key: こんな暖かくておいしいご飯を食べれるなんて、[r]
text.en-US: To be able to have such delicious warm food, [r]

text.key: 改めて幸せです…。[p]
text.en-US: I am again so very grateful...[p]

text.key: グラタン、おいしそうです。[lr]
text.en-US: The potatoes au gratin look tasty![lr]

text.key: あちち…[l]
text.en-US: Ow, ow, hot...! [l]

text.key: ふー、ふー。[lr]
text.en-US: _*blow* *blow*[lr]

text.key: …あむ。[p]
text.en-US: ...nom.[p]

text.key: とろけるソースと香ばしいチーズの香りがいいですね。[p]
text.en-US: The melty sauce and the sweet cheese smell are wonderful.[p]

text.key: ありがとうございます。[name]。[p]
text.en-US: Thank you very much, [name].[p]

text.key: 噴水の淵にシルヴィと腰かけ少しゆったりした。[p]
text.en-US: (Sylvie and I relax on the bench carved into the side of the fountain.[p]

text.key: （だんだん日も傾き始めてきた。[p]
text.en-US: Gradually, the daylight begins to wane.[p]

text.key: （今日はここらで切り上げよう。[p]
text.en-US: (I'll call it a day around here.[p]

text.key: こうして、街に出て落ち着けるのはなんだか新鮮です。[lr]
text.en-US: Going into town and merely relaxing like this is kind of refreshing.[lr]

text.key: [name]のところに来るまではそういう機会ってありませんでしたから。[p]
text.en-US: I never had a chance to do such a thing until I came to live with you after all, [name].[p]

text.key: 市場の方に比べてここら辺は人の流れが緩やかですね。[p]
text.en-US: Compared to the market, the flow of people seems to be more calm here.[p]

text.key: …こうして街の風景を眺めるのってなんだか不思議な感じですね。[p]
text.en-US: ...Just watching the world go by like this feels kind of strange.[p]

text.key: この世界は広くてたくさんの人がいろんな生き方をしているんですね。[lr]
text.en-US: You can't help but realize how big the world is, and how many people are living their own lives in it.[lr]

text.key: 私が[name]のところに来るまでの生活は狭くて不自由で、[r]
text.en-US: My life before meeting [name] was narrow and restrictive,[r]

text.key: 知ってはいてもそういう実感がなかったです。[p]
text.en-US: so even if I knew those things, I had no sense of reality about them.[p]

text.key: 人ごみの中でも[name]が隣にいると、そんなに不安にならないで済みます。[p]
text.en-US: Even in a crowded place like this, as long as [name] is by my side I can stay relaxed.[p]

text.key: あんまり出歩くことってなかったから、長く歩くと少し疲れちゃいますね。[lr]
text.en-US: I never really had much chance to walk outside, so walking for a long time makes me kind of tired.[lr]

text.key: でも、腰を下ろして初めてそれに気がつくぐらい[name]と一緒にお出かけするのは楽しいです。[p]
text.en-US: But having the chance to rest my legs and enjoy myself is all because I'm with you, [name].[p]

text.key: 噴水が綺麗ですね。[p]
text.en-US: The fountain sure is pretty.[p]

text.key: 水が噴き出して流れて…[r]
text.en-US: All it's doing is spraying water everywhere...[r]

text.key: それだけなのになんだかぼうっといつまでも眺めてしまいそう。[p]
text.en-US: And yet I feel like I could space out and watch it forever.[p]

text.key: 噴水ってこの街に来て初めて見ました。[lr]
text.en-US: Coming to this town is the first time I've seen a fountain.[lr]

text.key: 私が昔いたところにもあったのかな…。[p]
text.en-US: I wonder if there was one where I was living before...[p]

text.key: ほとんど街の様子を見る機会はなかったから、私が知らなかっただけかも。[p]
text.en-US: I never really had a chance to look around that town, so it could just be I was never aware of one being there.[p]

text.key: この街はなんだか不思議な雰囲気ですね。[lr]
text.en-US: This town has a kind of strange atmosphere to it, doesn't it?[lr]

text.key: 建物もたくさんあって、人の流れも遅くはないけど、[r]
text.en-US: There are lots of buildings, and the flow of people is anything but slow,[r]

text.key: なんだかゆっくり時間が流れてるみたいです。[p]
text.en-US: yet time seems to flow relatively slowly here.[p]

text.key: （シルヴィは穏やかな顔で街中を眺めている。[p]
text.en-US: (Sylvie stares into space with a serene expression on her face.[p]

text.key: …[name][p]
（シルヴィはそっとこちらの手を握ってきた。[p]
text.en-US: (Sylvie gently squeezed my hand.[p]

text.key: よく見るとこの街にも貧困の差はあるみたいですね。[lr]
text.en-US: Looking again, this town has its rich and poor as well, doesn't it?[lr]

text.key: でも、たまにお金持ちが目立つぐらいで、生活に困っていそうな人はあまり見ませんね。[p]
text.en-US: But it's more like occasionally the rich stand out, rather than the poor being unable to live.[p]

text.key: （シルヴィは流れる雲を眺めている。[p]
text.en-US: (Sylvie stares at the slowly-drifting clouds above us.[p]

text.key: …空のよく見える、素敵な広場ですね。[p]
text.en-US: This is a wonderful plaza, to be able to see so much of the sky.[p]

text.key: 昔は、「この人もひどいことをする怖い人かも」って、[r]
text.en-US: In the past I might have assumed that someone was going to do terrible things to me,[r]

text.key: 知らない人が目に入る度に怖がってました。[p]
text.en-US: so whenever I got caught in a stranger's gaze I became frightened.[p]

text.key: 今もそういうことがなくなったわけじゃ無いけど、[r]
text.en-US: It's not like that fear has completely disappeared,[r]

text.key: 隣に[name]がいれば少し安心できます。[p]
text.en-US: but as long as [name] is by my side I can find my calm.[p]

text.key: お店を見て回るのも楽しいですけど、[r]
text.en-US: Wandering around the different shops and such is fun too, but[r]

text.key: こうして人通りの少ないところをゆっくり歩いたり、座って休憩したりする方が落ち着きますね。[p]
text.en-US: wandering around a spot like this with less people and stopping to rest is much more calming.[p]

text.key: （ふとシルヴィと目があう。[p]
text.en-US: (My eyes accidentally wander across Sylvie's.[p]

text.key: 今の私ならこうして街を歩く人たちと同じように見えるんでしょか。[lr]
text.en-US: I wonder if I blend in with all the people around us now?[lr]

text.key: 誰かの奴隷じゃない、普通の人に。[p]
text.en-US: Not as a slave, but as a normal person.[p]

text.key: [name]のお家は街から少し外れたところにありますよね。[lr]
text.en-US: [name]'s home is kind of removed from town, isn't it?[lr]

text.key: 人の多いところに住むとやっぱり大変なこともあるんでしょうか？[p]
text.en-US: I wonder, is it because living surrounded by lots of people is troublesome?[p]

text.key: 私がいた施設のあった街とは全然違う景色です。[p]
text.en-US: The landscape here is completely different from that of where the facility I was living in before was.[p]

text.key: あの街は怖い顔やくたびれた顔をした人が多くて、[r]
text.en-US: That town had lots of people with scary faces or tired faces,[r]

text.key: 時々怒鳴り声や喧嘩の音が聞こえてきました。[lr]
text.en-US: and occasionally you could hear screams or the sound of people fighting.[lr]

text.key: 自由に出かけられたとしてもあまり出歩きたいとは思わなかったですね…。[p]
text.en-US: Even if I had been able to walk around freely, I don't think I would've wanted to wander around that place...[p]

text.key: 路上で楽器を弾いている人がいますね。[lr]
text.en-US: There's someone playing an instrument on that street.[lr]

text.key: 多分ヴァイオリン…ですよね？[p]
text.en-US: It's a violin...I think?[p]

text.key: 音楽や楽器のことは良くわからないですけど、綺麗な音ですね。[p]
text.en-US: I don't know much about music or musical instruments, but it sounds very pretty.[p]

text.key: （そよ風がシルヴィの髪を揺らしている[p]
text.en-US: (The gentle wind brushes through Sylvie's hair.[p]

text.key: （食品から加工品までいろんなものが売っている市場へ来た。[p]
text.en-US: (We arrived at the market selling everything from foodstuffs to manufactured goods.[p]

text.key: （普段は買い物は近場で済ませているが、[r]
text.en-US: (I usually shop somewhere closer, [r]

text.key: シルヴィと一緒なら珍しいものを眺めるだけでも楽しめるだろう。[p]
text.en-US: but since I'm together with Sylvie I'm sure she can enjoy herself seeing some unusual things.[p]

text.key: こんな市場があったんですね。[lr]
text.en-US: So there was a market like this.[lr]

text.key: 人がたくさん…。[p]
text.en-US: There are so many people...[p]

text.key: いろんなものがありそうですね。[p]
text.en-US: It looks like there are a lot of things.[p]

text.key: （市場に来た。[p]
text.en-US: (We've arrived at the market.[p]

text.key: （ちらほらと店じまいを始めるのが目に入る…。[p]
text.en-US: (I can see a lot of places closing up shop...[p]

text.key: お酒を売っているところもあるんですね。[p]
text.en-US: So there are places that sell alcohol too.[p]

text.key: 私でも飲めそうなのはあるかな？[p]
text.en-US: I wonder if they have something even I might be able to drink?[p]

text.key: 私はお酒飲んだことはないですけど、おいしいんですよね？[p]
text.en-US: I've never drank alcohol before, but is it good?[p]

text.key: いつか大きくなったら飲んでみたいです。[p]
text.en-US: Once I grow up I'd like to try tasting it.[p]

text.key: このお芋？長くて赤いですね。[p]
text.en-US: What is this potato? It's long and red.[p]

text.key: サツマイモ？[lr]
text.en-US: Sweet potato?[lr]

text.key: お芋で、甘いんですか？[p]
text.en-US: It's a potato, but it's sweet?[p]

text.key: どんな風に料理するんでしょう…。[p]
text.en-US: I wonder how you're supposed to cook this...[p]

text.key: トマトが売ってますね。[p]
text.en-US: They're selling tomatoes here.[p]

text.key: 生のトマトは…、そんなに好きじゃないなぁ。[p]
text.en-US: I don't like... raw tomatoes very much.[p]

text.key: トマトソースとかは大丈夫なんですけど。[p]
text.en-US: I'm okay with tomato sauce, though.[p]

text.key: コーヒーのいい香り…。[lr]
text.en-US: The scent of coffee...[lr]

text.key: 豆が売ってるんですね。[p]
text.en-US: They seem to be selling coffee beans.[p]

text.key: 匂いはこんなにいい匂いなのに、コーヒーそのものはあんなに苦いなんて…。[p]
text.en-US: The smell itself is nice, but coffee is so bitter...[p]

text.key: 美味しそうに飲める人が羨ましいです。[p]
text.en-US: I'm jealous of people who enjoy drinking it.[p]

text.key: ニンジンが並んでる…。[p]
text.en-US: Carrots are lined up here...[p]

text.key: ニンジンって植物の根っこなんですよね？[lr]
text.en-US: Carrots are the roots of a plant, right?[lr]

text.key: オレンジ色の根っこなんて、不思議ですね。[p]
text.en-US: The roots are orange... How strange.[p]

text.key: いろんな色のパプリカが…。[p]
text.en-US: There's various coloured paprika here...[p]

text.key: 同じパプリカなのにいろんな色があって面白いですね。[p]
text.en-US: It's funny how they're all paprika but they have many different colours.[p]

text.key: しかも絵の具で塗ったみたいな派手な色。[lr]
text.en-US: And they're flashy colors like those in a painting. [lr]

text.key: 絵の具を肥料にしてる…わけないか。[p]
text.en-US: Maybe they use it for paint...? Of course not.[p]

text.key: 人がたくさんですね。[lr]
text.en-US: There are a lot of people.[lr]

text.key: 手、少し強く握ってもいいですか？[p]
text.en-US: Is it... okay if I hold your hand a little harder?[p]

text.key: いろんなものが売ってますね。[lr]
text.en-US: They are selling a lot of different things here.[lr]

text.key: 野菜、果物、保存食に小物まで。[p]
text.en-US: Vegetables, fruits, preserved foods, and accessories.[p]

text.key: 棚の上がカラフルで、いろんな匂いもする…。[p]
text.en-US: The top shelf is colourful, and there are various smells...[p]

text.key: 玉ねぎがたくさん。[lr]
text.en-US: So many onions.[lr]

text.key: いろんなお料理に使えるんですよね？[p]
text.en-US: You can use them for various dishes, right?[p]

text.key: いつか私も色々作れるようになりたいです。[p]
text.en-US: I want to be able to cook many dishes someday.[p]

text.key: おっきなかぼちゃ。[p]
text.en-US: What a big pumpkin.[p]

text.key: パイにするぐらいしか料理が思いつかないんですけど、[r]
text.en-US: The only way I know you can cook this is use it in a pie, [r]

text.key: 他にも何かあるんでしょうか？[p]
text.en-US: but there are other dishes you can make, right?[p]

text.key: 一個全部パイにしたら私と[name]だけじゃ食べ切れませんね。[p]
text.en-US: If we turned the whole pumpkin into a pie, I don't think just [name] and I will be able to eat it all.[p]

text.key: スパイスがたくさん並んでますね。[p]
text.en-US: There are a lot of spices lined up.[p]

text.key: ほんのちょっとならいい香りだけど、[r]
text.en-US: It smells nice if it's only a little, [r]

text.key: こんなにたくさんだと匂いも濃いですね。[p]
text.en-US: but with this much the smell is too strong.[p]

text.key: いろんな匂いがして目眩がしそうです。[p]
text.en-US: All these different smells are making me dizzy.[p]

text.key: セロリだ。…正直あんまり好きじゃないです。[p]
text.en-US: It's celery.... I don't like it very much to be honest.[p]

text.key: アスパラとかも、青臭いっていうんでしょうか？[lr]
text.en-US: Asparagus, too. How do I say it? They smell grassy?[lr]

text.key: 草みたいな香りが苦手で…。[p]
text.en-US: I don't like that grassy smell very much...[p]

text.key: あ、いろんなジャムが並んでる…。[p]
text.en-US: Ah, they're selling various jams here...[p]

text.key: 瓶に入ったジャムは綺麗でいろんな色があって、[lr]
text.en-US: There are so many different coloured jars of jam. [lr]

text.key: 味を想像するのも楽しいし、ワクワクしちゃいます。[p]
text.en-US: Just imagining the different flavours is making me excited.[p]

text.key: あ、オレンジが落っこちて…。[lr]
text.en-US: Ah, an orange fell...[lr]

text.key: よいしょ、[p]
text.en-US: Heave ho...[p]

text.key: 元の場所に戻しておきましょう。[p]
text.en-US: Let's put it back where it was.[p]

text.key: これはオレンジ[lr]
text.en-US: This is... [lr]

text.key: …じゃないですね。[p]
text.en-US: ...Not an orange.[p]

text.key: みかん？[lr]
text.en-US: Mandarin orange?[lr]

text.key: オレンジより小さいけど、おいしいんでしょうか？[p]
text.en-US: It's smaller than a regular orange, but does it taste good?[p]

text.key: 真っ赤なりんご、いい香りがしますね。[p]
text.en-US: A bright red apple. It has a nice smell.[p]

text.key: りんごってこうして並んでるのを見ると、[r]
text.en-US: When I see apples displayed like this, [r]

text.key: カットしないでそのまま齧ってみたくなります[p]
text.en-US: it makes me want to eat them whole instead of cutting them.[p]

text.key: あ、メロンが安いですね。[p]
text.en-US: Ah, melons are on sale.[p]

text.key: でも荷物になっちゃうし[r]
text.en-US: But it'd be a burden, [r]

text.key: お散歩ついでに買えるものじゃないですね。[p]
text.en-US: so we should only buy things we can carry easily.[p]

text.key: 丸ごとのパイナップル…おっきいですね。[p]
text.en-US: A whole pineapple... It's big.[p]

text.key: これ、そのまま買って帰っても剥くのが大変そう…。[lr]
text.en-US: Even if we bought it, it seems like it would be troublesome to peel and cut...[lr]

text.key: 特別な道具とかなくても剥けるのかな。[p]
text.en-US: I wonder if you can peel it without special utensils.[p]

text.key: ぶどうがたくさん並んでますね…。[p]
text.en-US: There are a lot of grapes...[p]

text.key: え、一つ味見してもいいんですか？[p]
text.en-US: Eh? I can taste one?[p]

text.key: …ん、甘い…♡[p]
text.en-US: ...Mm, sweet...♡[p]

text.key: イチゴがたくさん。[p]
text.en-US: There are a lot of strawberries.[p]

text.key: そのまま食べても美味しそうだけど…[lr]
text.en-US: It would be tasty just eating it as is...[lr]

text.key: ケーキのイチゴ思い出しちゃいます。[p]
text.en-US: It reminds me of the strawberry on the cake.[p]

text.key: 面白い形の果物？ですね。[lr]
text.en-US: It looks like a white coloured fruit?[lr]

text.key: スターフルーツ？[p]
text.en-US: Starfruit?[p]

text.key: あ、切ると星型になるんですね。面白い…。[p]
text.en-US: Ah, because if you cut it it looks like a star. How interesting...[p]

text.key: バナナが積んである。[p]
text.en-US: There are bananas piled up here.[p]

text.key: 刃物がいらないから食べやすくっていいですよね。[p]
text.en-US: Bananas are nice and easy to eat because you don't need a knife.[p]

text.key: マフィンやケーキにもできるらしいですよ。[lr]
text.en-US: It seems like you can use them for muffins and cakes as well.[lr]

text.key: [name]のためにいつか作ってみたいです。[p]
text.en-US: I want to try making some for you, [name].[p]

text.key: あ、さくらんぼ[lr]
text.en-US: Ah, cherries![lr]

text.key: …じゃない。[p]
text.en-US: ...Or not.[p]

text.key: なんでしょうこれ？[lr]
text.en-US: I wonder what this is?[lr]

text.key: …アセロラ？[p]
text.en-US: ...Acerola?[p]

text.key: 香りもさくらんぼとはだいぶ違いますね。[lr]
text.en-US: The smell is quite different from a cherry.[lr]

text.key: おいしいのかな？[p]
text.en-US: Does it taste good?[p]

text.key: なんだかトゲトゲで堅そうなのが…。[lr]
text.en-US: There's something that looks spikey and hard...[lr]

text.key: これなんでしょう？[p]
text.en-US: I wonder what this is?[p]

text.key: ドリアン？[lr]
text.en-US: Durian?[lr]

text.key: …臭いけど、甘いんですか？[p]
text.en-US: ...It's smelly, but it's sweet?[p]

text.key: どんな味か想像しにくいですね…。[lr]
text.en-US: It's hard to imagine what it tastes like...[lr]

text.key: 食べてみたいような、みたくないような…。[p]
text.en-US: I want to try eating it, yet at the same time I don't...[p]

text.key: なんだかいろんな色があって綺麗だけど、これなんでしょう。[p]
text.en-US: There are various colours and it looks pretty, but I wonder what this is.[p]

text.key: あ、よく見たらロウソクですね。[p]
text.en-US: Ah, now that I look closely they're candles.[p]

text.key: アロマキャンドル？[lr]
text.en-US: Aroma candle?[lr]

text.key: あかりのためのロウソクとは違うんだ。[p]
text.en-US: So they're different from candles used for light.[p]

text.key: ガラスの食器が並んでますね。[p]
text.en-US: There's glass tableware here.[p]

text.key: キラキラしてて綺麗…。[p]
text.en-US: The way they sparkle is beautiful...[p]

text.key: でもここまで凝ったものだと、[r]
text.en-US: But the idea of using something [r]

text.key: 日常的に使うのはちょっと怖そうですね。[p]
text.en-US: elaborate like this for everyday use is kind of scary.[p]

text.key: あ、端の方に来ちゃいましたね。[lr]
text.en-US: Ah, we've come close to the end.[lr]

text.key: お店はここまでみたいです。[p]
text.en-US: It seems like the shops end here.[p]

text.key: 戻って別の方を見てみましょうか。[p]
text.en-US: We should go back and go another direction.[p]

text.key: あ、いろんなお茶が売ってますよ。[p]
text.en-US: Ah, they're selling a lot of teas over here.[p]

text.key: コーヒーは飲めないけど、[r]
text.en-US: I can't drink coffee, [r]

text.key: お茶なら飲めるから味を想像できて楽しいです。[p]
text.en-US: but I can drink tea so it's fun imagining how these taste.[p]

text.key: なんだか変な…置物？が売ってるみたいですね。[p]
text.en-US: They're selling some strange... ornaments?[p]

text.key: いろんなのがあって面白いけど…[r]
text.en-US: There are a lot of interesting looking things, but...[r]

text.key: どれもうちに飾ってもあまり合いそうにないですね。[p]
text.en-US: None of them seem like they would fit in as decoration in the house.[p]

text.key: なんだか香辛料の香りが…。[p]
text.en-US: Something smells like spice...[p]

text.key: あ、干し肉が売ってるんだ。[lr]
text.en-US: Ah, they're selling dried meat.[lr]

text.key: …結構値段するんですね。[p]
text.en-US: ...It's quite pricey.[p]

text.key: 自分で作るのも大変そうだし、手間を考えたらそんなものなのかな。[p]
text.en-US: It seems like it would take a lot of time and effort, so I can understand the pricing.[p]

text.key: おや、どうも先生。[p]
text.en-US: Well, hello doctor.[p]

text.key: （声をかけられて振り向くといつぞやの男が立っていた。[p]
text.en-US: (I turn in the direction I heard the voice and see the man from that time.[p]

text.key: どうやら、それとはうまくいっているようですね。[p]
text.en-US: It seems like you're getting along with that.[p]

text.key: （シルヴィをちらりと見て言ったところを見ると「それ」とは彼女のことだろう。[p]
text.en-US: (Since he looked at Sylvie when he said it, 「that」 must refer to her.[p]

text.key: ここでは最近商談がうまく進んでましてね。[lr]
text.en-US: Negotiations have been going steadily around here recently. [lr]

text.key: この街にはたまに出入りするようになったんです。[p]
text.en-US: I've been coming in and out of town often.[p]

text.key: もしかしたらこれからも顔をあわせることになるかもしれませんね。[p]
text.en-US: It may be possible that we run into one another again some time.[p]

text.key: しかし今日はちょっとしたトラブルがありまして、[r]
text.en-US: However, I've encountered a bit of trouble today, [r]

text.key: 私がわざわざ積荷の一部を運ぶ羽目になっちまって…。[p]
text.en-US: and I've been roped into carrying a part of the cargo...[p]

text.key: 今は足を待ってるところです。[p]
text.en-US: I'm waiting on them right now.[p]

text.key: （男は隣に置いてある大きな荷物に手を置き少し不機嫌そうに顔をしかめた。[p]
text.en-US: (The man makes an unpleasant face as he places his hand on the large luggage next to him.[p]

text.key: そうだ、せっかくですから先生も何か見てみますか？[p]
text.en-US: I know! Since we've bumped into each other, will you take a look around, doctor?[p]

text.key: 私も暫くここから動けないし、[r]買い手が決まってないものなんで欲しいものがあればお売りしますよ。[p]
text.en-US: I won't be able to move from here for a while, [r]and we haven't found a buyer yet so if there's anything you want then I'm willing to sell.[p]

text.key: 先生の興味の持ちそうなものは、そうだな…これなんてどうでしょう？[p]
text.en-US: Something that would interest you... Let's see... What about something like this?[p]

text.key: （男は荷物の中から本を一冊取り出した。[p]
text.en-US: (The man took a single book out from inside his luggage.[p]

text.key: こいつは国外の薬学を訳したものらしくてですね、ここらでは珍しいものですよ。[p]
text.en-US: This is apparently something from a foreign pharmaceutical company that was translated,[r]so it's rather rare.[p]

text.key: （軽く中を見てみると、ある項目に目が止まる。[p]
text.en-US: (I lightly flip through the pages, and my eyes stop on a certain item.[p]

text.key: （大半は聞いたこともない植物を材料にしているが、[r]
text.en-US: (The majority of the ingredients are plants that I've never heard of, [r]

text.key: この薬は手近なものでもできるようだ…。[p]
text.en-US: but it seems like I can still make it with materials I have on hand...[p]

text.key: 興味は惹かれたようですね。[p]
text.en-US: It seems like it's caught your interest.[p]

text.key: それなりに値は張りますが…、多少はお安くしますよ。[p]
text.en-US: It's expensive, but for you... I'll keep it at a reasonable price.[p]

text.key: （シルヴィの件もあるし多めにもらった治療費を返すつもりで購入しようか…。[p]
text.en-US: (Well, there was the matter with Sylvie, so I'll buy it to repay some of the extra he paid[r]for his treatment fee...[p]

text.key: それはそれは。お買い上げありがとうございます。[p]
text.en-US: Well, well. Thank you for your patronage.[p]

text.key: お、ちょうど迎えもきたようです。[p]
text.en-US: Oh, perfect. It seems like the person I'm meeting with just arrived.[p]

text.key: また機会があればお会いしましょう。[p]
text.en-US: Let's meet again if we have the opportunity.[p]

text.key: （男は去っていった。[p]
text.en-US: (The man left.[p]

text.key: （市場を離れた。[p]
text.en-US: (We left the market.[p]

text.key: （服屋にやってきた。[p]
text.en-US: (I arrived at the clothes shop.[p]

text.key: （何か買おうか？[p]
text.en-US: (What shall I buy?[p]

text.key: （落ち着いた服「黒」
text.en-US: (I bought the plain clothes in black.[p]

text.key: （落ち着いた服「紫」
text.en-US: (I bought the plain clothes in purple.[p]

text.key: （落ち着いた服「赤」
text.en-US: (I bought the plain clothes in red.[p]

text.key: （落ち着いた服「緑」
text.en-US: (I bought the plain clothes in green.[p]

text.key: （落ち着いた服「茶」
text.en-US: (I bought the plain clothes in brown.[p]

text.key: （ヒラヒラした服を買った。[p]
text.en-US: (I bought the sleeveless dress.[p]

text.key: 軽くてヒラヒラした服。リボンもたくさんで、…かわいい。[lr]
text.en-US: Such light and frilly clothes. There are a lot of ribbons, too... It's cute.[lr]

text.key: ありがとうございます。[p]
text.en-US: Thank you very much.[p]

text.key: （黒いヒラヒラした服
text.en-US: (I bought the sleeveless dress in black.[p]

text.key: （緑のヒラヒラした服
text.en-US: (I bought the sleeveless dress in green.[p]

text.key: （赤いヒラヒラした服
text.en-US: (I bought the sleeveless dress in red.[p]

text.key: （紫のヒラヒラした服
text.en-US: (I bought the sleeveless dress in purple.[p]

text.key: （茶色のヒラヒラした服
text.en-US: (I bought the sleeveless dress in brown.[p]

text.key: （ピンクのヒラヒラした服
text.en-US: (I bought the sleeveless dress in pink.[p]

text.key: （青いワンピースを買った[p]
text.en-US: (I bought the blue one piece dress.[p]

text.key: これは…かわいいワンピースですね。[lr]涼しげで、動きやすそう。[p]
text.en-US: This is... a really cute dress. [lr]It looks cool and easy to move in.[p]

text.key: 買っていただけるんですか？[lr]
text.en-US: Are you really buying this for me?[lr]

text.key: これを着て[name]とお出かけしたいですね。[p]
text.en-US: I want to wear this and go out somewhere with you, [name].[p]

text.key: （黄色いワンピース
text.en-US: (I bought the yellow one piece dress.[p]

text.key: （赤いワンピース
text.en-US: (I bought the red one piece dress.[p]

text.key: （紫のワンピース
text.en-US: (I bought the purple one piece dress.[p]

text.key: （白いワンピース
text.en-US: (I bought the white one piece dress.[p]

text.key: これは…。前に買っていただいた服とは生地の色が違いますね。[p]
text.en-US: This is... a different color from the one you bought for me before.[p]

text.key: 色が違うだけで雰囲気も変わりますね。[lr]これも、私が着ても良いんですか？[p]
text.en-US: Just a change in color makes it give off a different feel. [lr]Is it alright for me to wear this?[p]

text.key: これは…。前に買っていただいた服とは生地の色が違いますね。[lr]
text.en-US: This is... a different color from the one you bought for me before.[lr]

text.key: 色が違うだけで雰囲気も変わりますね。[lr]
text.en-US: Just a change in color makes it give off a different feel.[lr]

text.key: 早く着てみたいです。[p]
text.en-US: I want to try this on soon.[p]

text.key: （ナース服を買った。[p]
text.en-US: (I bought the nurse uniform.[p]

text.key: これは…看護婦さんの服ですね。[lr]これを着て[name]のお仕事をお手伝いさせていただけるんですか？[p]
text.en-US: This is... a nurse uniform. [lr]Will I be wearing this and helping with your work, [name]?[p]

text.key: ありがとうございます。[r]
text.en-US: Thank you very much.[r]

text.key: 私[name]のお役に立てるようたくさん頑張りますね。[p]
text.en-US: I'll do my best to help you, [name].[p]

text.key: （ピンクのナース服を買った[p]
text.en-US: (I bought the pink nurse uniform.[p]

text.key: これは…前のとは違う色のナース服ですね。[lr]予備ということでしょうか。[p]
text.en-US: This is... a different color from the nurse uniform you bought for me before. [lr]Is this a spare?[p]

text.key: こっちはちょっとかわいいですね。[p]
text.en-US: This one is kind of cute.[p]

text.key: 私もっと頑張ります。[p]

text.key: ん…サクサクしてておいしい。[p]
text.en-US: Mm...it's crunchy and delicious.[p]

text.key: 普通のパンでもひと手間加えるだけでおいしいお菓子になるんですね。[p]
text.en-US: Just by putting a little care into regular bread it can become a tasty snack.[p]

text.key: これぐらいなら私でもすぐ作れるようになるかな…。[p]
text.en-US: I wonder if even I could learn to make this...[p]

text.key: ふふっ…おいしい。[p]
text.en-US: Hehe...it's tasty![p]

text.key: お店で食べるのも雰囲気があっていいですけど、[r]
text.en-US: Eating at the restaurant has a certain pleasant feel to it,[r]

text.key: やっぱり[name]と二人きりのほうが少し落ち着くような気がします。[p]
text.en-US: but eating with [name] alone is really quite calming.[p]

text.key: あむ…、おいしい。[p]
text.en-US: Nom... Tasty.[p]

text.key: ほろ苦いチョコレートとお茶の香りがよく合いますね。[p]
text.en-US: The bittersweet chocolate and the tea's aroma go quite well together.[p]

text.key: ケーキよりもしっかりした生地だからなおさらお茶がおいしい気がします。[p]
text.en-US: It's more flavorful than cake, so it makes the tea taste that much better.[p]

text.key: ん…甘い。[p]
text.en-US: Mm... So sweet.[p]

text.key: プリンだとストレートの紅茶でちょうどいいですね。[lr]
text.en-US: Straight black tea would be better with custard, wouldn't it?[lr]

text.key: 間にお茶を挟まないで食べたらすぐなくなっちゃいそうです。[p]
text.en-US: If I don't stop to drink some tea I think I'll finish it all at once.[p]

text.key: …おいしい。[p]
text.en-US: ...Tasty.[p]

text.key: いろんなフルーツをちょっとずつ楽しめるのがいいですね。[p]
text.en-US: Enjoying each of the fruits individually is probably best.[p]

text.key: こんなにたくさんの種類のフルーツを普通に買ったら傷む前に食べきれないですし、[lr]
text.en-US: If you bought this many different fruits normally they'd spoil before you ate them all,[lr]

text.key: スイーツになってると同じフルーツでも違った味に感じます。[p]
text.en-US: and even if they didn't they'd taste differently from when they're part of this dessert.[p]

text.key: …はむ。[lr]
text.en-US: ...nom.[lr]

text.key: んふ、おぃひぃです…。[p]
text.en-US: Mmf, ifs tayfy...[p]

text.key: ん…こくん。[lr]
text.en-US: Mm... *gulp*[lr]

text.key: すいません、行儀が悪かったですね。[p]
text.en-US: I'm sorry, that was poor manners wasn't it.[p]

text.key: でも、口いっぱいに甘いものを頬張るとつい気持ちもほころんじゃいます。[lr]
text.en-US: But to have such sweetness fill my mouth just makes me so happy I can't help it.[lr]

text.key: ふわふわで、クリームとチョコレートが口の中で混ざって…。[p]
text.en-US: It's so fluffy, and the way the cream and chocolate mix in your mouth...[p]

text.key: ふわふわな舌触りで美味しい…。[p]
text.en-US: It's so chewy and tasty...[p]

text.key: 派手さはないけど優しい味がします。[lr]
text.en-US: It's not fancy-looking, but it tastes very soft.[lr]

text.key: スポンジがしっとりしてるから軽いお菓子に比べて結構食べた気になりますね。[p]
text.en-US: The sponginess absorbs everything, so it's pretty filling for a light snack.[p]

text.key: はむ。[p]
text.en-US: Nom.[p]

text.key: んー、軽い生地とたっぷりのクリーム、[lr]
text.en-US: Mmm, this light texture, this abundance of cream...[lr]

text.key: これだけの組み合わせでこんなに美味しい…。[p]
text.en-US: To think such a simple combination would be so tasty...[p]

text.key: お菓子を考える人はすごいですね。[p]
text.en-US: People who think up sweets sure are amazing.[p]

text.key: 羊羹…これは異国のお菓子なんですよね？[lr]
text.en-US: 'Youkan'... This is a snack from a foreign country, right?[lr]

text.key: このあいだの「どら焼き」と同じ国のものなんですか。[p]
text.en-US: Is it the same country that 'dorayaki' from before was from?[p]

text.key: 黒くてツヤがあって…最初はチョコレートのゼリーみたいなものかと思いましたけど、[r]
text.en-US: It's black and shiny, so I thought it was chocolate jelly at first, [r]

text.key: チョコみたいな匂いじゃないし、なんだか違う気がしますね。[p]
text.en-US: but it doesn't smell like chocolate so I doubt it is.[p]

text.key: とにかく、頂いてみましょうか…。[p]
text.en-US: I guess I should just try some...[p]

text.key: ん、甘い。[p]
text.en-US: Mm, it's sweet.[p]

text.key: このあいだの「どら焼き」と少し似てるのかな？[lr]
text.en-US: It kinda taste like that 'dorayaki' from the other day.[lr]

text.key: 今まで食べたことのない味がします。[lr]
text.en-US: It definitely is different from anything I've eaten before.[lr]

text.key: 不思議な味だけど、美味しいですね。[p]
text.en-US: It's a strange taste, but not in a bad way.[p]

text.key: ずっしりしてる代わりに量は多くないし、[r]
text.en-US: It's thick, but there isn't as much of it, [r]

text.key: 少しずつお茶を飲みながら食べるのがいいのかな。[p]
text.en-US: so eating it slowly with tea is probably best.[p]

text.key: ん…。[lr]
text.en-US: Hm...[lr]

text.key: 珍しい味だけど、美味しいですね。[p]
text.en-US: It's an unusual taste, but it's good.[p]

text.key: 一口でたくさん口に入れないから[r]
text.en-US: You can't fit much into your mouth in one bite, [r]

text.key: 食べることより味を楽しむ感覚のほうが強い気がします。[lr]
text.en-US: so I feel that savoring each bite slowly is best.[lr]

text.key: そういう食べ物なんでしょうか？[p]
text.en-US: Is this that sort of food?[p]

text.key: どら焼き…これは異国のお菓子なんですよね？[lr]
text.en-US: 'Dorayaki'... This is another foreign snack, isn't it?[lr]

text.key: このあいだの「羊羹」と同じ国のものなんですか。[lr]
text.en-US: Could it be the same country the 'youkan' from the other day was from?[lr]

text.key: 小さなパンケーキみたいなので何か挟んであるみたいですね。[p]
text.en-US: It looks like a tiny pancake, so perhaps there's something inside it?[p]

text.key: じゃあ、頂いてみますね。[p]
text.en-US: I'll try some now, then.[p]

text.key: ん、スポンジ部分も甘いんだ…。[lr]
text.en-US: Mm, the spongy bit tastes good too...[lr]

text.key: 間には何か黒くて甘いものが、豆みたいのが入ってる？[p]
text.en-US: In the middle is something black and sweet...that tastes like beans?[p]

text.key: このあいだの「羊羹」と少し似てるのかな？[lr]
text.en-US: It's almost like that 'youkan' from the other day.[lr]

text.key: 何だか不思議な味ですね。[lr]
text.en-US: What a strange taste it has.[lr]

text.key: 結構好みかもしれません。美味しいです。[p]
text.en-US: I might actually like it. It's tasty.[p]

text.key: 美味しい。[p]
text.en-US: Tasty.[p]

text.key: このペースト状の甘い部分、[r]
text.en-US: This sweet paste part of it [r]

text.key: 他のお菓子にはない不思議な舌触りですね。[lr]
text.en-US: has a completely different texture from any other snack I've had.[lr]

text.key: 食べててちょっと面白いです。[p]
text.en-US: What an interesting thing to eat.[p]

text.key: （買ってきた酒をシルヴィと試してみよう。[p]
text.en-US: (Let's try out that wine with Sylvie.[p]

text.key: お酒…？[lr]
text.en-US: Alcohol...?[lr]

text.key: 一緒にいただいていいんですか？[p]
text.en-US: Is it all right for me to have some with you?[p]

text.key: （控えめにグラスに注ぎ、少し水で割ってシルヴィに渡す。[p]
text.en-US: (For moderation's sake I poured a little into a glass and diluted it with water before handing it to Sylvie.[p]

text.key: ん、なんだか甘い匂い。[lr]
text.en-US: Hm, it smells somewhat sweet.[lr]

text.key: いい香りですね。[p]
text.en-US: It's a nice fragrance.[p]

text.key: …果物をつけた甘くて珍しいお酒？[lr]
text.en-US: ...A strange, fruity alcohol?[lr]

text.key: そんなものもあるんですか。[p]
text.en-US: So something like this exists...[p]

text.key: じゃあ、いただきます。[lr]
text.en-US: Well, I'll have some.[lr]

text.key: えっと…乾杯です。[p]
text.en-US: Um... cheers![p]

text.key: んく…。[p]
なんだか甘くてジュースみたいですけど、お酒っぽい香りもしますね。[lr]
text.en-US: It's kind of sweet like juice, but at the same time it has an alcoholic scent.[lr]

text.key: 飲みやすくて美味しいです。[p]
text.en-US: It's tasty and easy to drink.[p]

text.key: （シルヴィと少しお酒を楽しもう。[p]
text.en-US: (Let's enjoy this alcohol with Sylvie for a bit.[p]

text.key: 一緒にいただいていいんですか？[lr]
text.en-US: Is it all right to join you?[lr]

text.key: はい、いただきます。[p]
text.en-US: Yes, I'll have some.[p]

text.key: じゃあ、乾杯です。[p]
text.en-US: Well, cheers![p]

text.key: んく…[lr]
text.en-US: _*gulp*...[lr]

text.key: （もう夜も遅くなってきた。[p]
text.en-US: (The night is growing old.[p]

text.key: （もうボトルは空だ。[p]
text.en-US: The bottle's totally empty.[p]

text.key: （これ以上は飲ませないほうがいいだろう[p]
text.en-US: (I don't think I should let her have any more.[p]

text.key: おかわりいただいていいんですか？[lr]
text.en-US: Is it all right to get another glass?[lr]

text.key: ありがとうございます。じゃあいただきます。[p]
text.en-US: Thank you very much. I'll have some.[lr]

text.key: （シルヴィのグラスに酒を注ぎ足した。[p]
text.en-US: (I filled Sylvie's glass with wine.[p]

text.key: んく…。[lr]
text.en-US: _*gulp*...[lr]

text.key: お酒にもいろいろ種類があるんですよね。[lr]
text.en-US: There sure are lots of kinds of alcohol.[lr]

text.key: こういう甘いのだったらジュースみたいで飲みやすいです。[p]
text.en-US: Sweet things like this are like juice and are very easy to drink.[p]

text.key: 昔に赤ワインをひと口だけ、飲んだことがあるんですけど[r]
text.en-US: I have had a sip of red wine in the past, but[r]

text.key: 渋くてあんまり美味しくは感じませんでしたね。[p]
text.en-US: it was bitter and didn't taste very good.[p]

text.key: でも、どこかいい香りもしたので、[r]
text.en-US: But it had a nice scent to it,[r]

text.key: いつか舌がもっと大人になったらワインも楽しめるようになるのかなって思います。[p]
text.en-US: so I thought that maybe my tongue would grow up someday so I could enjoy wine.[p]

text.key: お酒を飲むとなんだか大人になった気分になります。[p]
text.en-US: Drinking alcohol like this makes me feel like I've become an adult.[p]

text.key: ちょっと体がポカポカしてきたかもしれません。[p]
text.en-US: My body's kinda warm I think.[p]

text.key: 冷たい飲み物なのに、喉を通るとあったかい。[lr]
text.en-US: It's a cold drink, but when it goes down my throat it becomes warm...[lr]

text.key: 不思議ですね。[p]
text.en-US: How strange.[p]

text.key: [name]はどんなお酒が好きなんでしょうか。[lr]
text.en-US: I wonder, what sort of alcohol do you like, [name]?[lr]

text.key: [name]のお気に入りとかがあったら、私もいつか試してみたいな…なんて。[p]
text.en-US: If there's something you like, I'd like to share it with you someday...or something.[p]

text.key: …ふふ♡[p]
text.en-US: ...Hehe♡[p]

text.key: 誰かと一緒にお酒を楽しむって、大人の贅沢って感じですね。[p]
text.en-US: Being able to share alcohol with someone is the luxury of adults, huh?[p]

text.key: 美味しいですね♡[p]
text.en-US: This sure is tasty♡[p]

text.key: お酒って飲みながらつまむ食べ物がありますよね、[lr]
text.en-US: Alcohol usually has little bite-sized snacks that go along with it,[lr]

text.key: チーズとかオリーブとか。[p]
text.en-US: like cheese or oilives, right?[p]

text.key: お酒によって合うものも違うらしいですけど、[r]
text.en-US: What snack goes with what alcohol is different, but[r]

text.key: こういうお酒にはどんなものが合うんでしょうね。[p]
text.en-US: I wonder what sort would go best with this one?[p]

text.key: お酒のおつまみって色々食べたことがあるわけじゃないけど、[lr]
text.en-US: I haven't really eaten many hors d'oeuvres,[lr]

text.key: お茶菓子と違ってそれだけで美味しいものは少ない気がしますね。[p]
text.en-US: but unlike tea snacks, I get the feeling they wouldn't be as good on their own.[p]

text.key: 私の好みの問題なんでしょうか？[p]
text.en-US: Is it more a problem with my tastes I wonder?[p]

text.key: ほんの少し…眠くなってきたような気がします。[lr]
text.en-US: I feel like... I've gotten a little bit sleepy.[lr]

text.key: …お酒でぼんやりしてるんでしょうか？[p]
text.en-US: ...I wonder if it's the alcohol making me a little woozy?[p]

text.key: 美味しいお酒、ありがとうございます。[name]。[p]
text.en-US: Thank you for the delicious wine, [name].[p]

text.key: ボトルの方の匂いを嗅いだら少しくらっとしました。[lr]
text.en-US: Smelling directly from the bottle makes me feel a little dizzy.[lr]

text.key: 水で薄めてもそんなに味薄く感じませんし、濃いお酒なんですね。[p]
text.en-US: Even diluted with water the taste doesn't seem weaker, so it must be a strong wine.[p]

text.key: 嫌なことがあるとお酒に溺れてしまう人もいるらしいですね。[lr]
text.en-US: There are people who drown their worries in alcohol, aren't there?[lr]

text.key: 私はその心配はないと思いますけど。[p]
text.en-US: I'm not worried about that though.[p]

text.key: こんな甘いお酒があるなんて知りませんでした。[lr]
text.en-US: I had no idea such sweet alcohol existed.[lr]

text.key: きっと他にも私の知らないお酒がたくさんあるんでしょうね。[p]
text.en-US: There must be lots of different types of alcohol I have no knowledge of.[p]

text.key: お酒ってものによってアルコールの強さが違うらしいですけど、[r]
text.en-US: It seems that the amount of alcohol is different between different drinks,[r]

text.key: これはどれぐらいなんでしょうね？[lr]
text.en-US: but how much alcohol is in this one, I wonder?[lr]

text.key: 私が飲めるぐらいだからそんなに強くはないんでしょうけど。[p]
text.en-US: I can drink it, so it can't be that strong, right?[p]

text.key: お酒と言ったらガラスの瓶ですね。[lr]
text.en-US: When it comes to wine they come in bottles don't they?[lr]

text.key: ものによって形や大きさが違って綺麗ですよね。[p]
text.en-US: Different drinks come in different shapes and sizes, but they're all so pretty.[p]

text.key: 空になっても捨てるのがもったいないです。[p]
text.en-US: Even if it becomes empty, it seems like a waste to just throw it away...[p]

text.key: そういえば飲む量が多くないからだと思いますけど、[r]
text.en-US: Thinking about it, it could be because I haven't had very much of it,[r]

text.key: 今の所お酒を飲んだ翌日に頭が痛くなったりしたことはないですね。[p]
text.en-US: but I haven't ever woken up the next day with a headache from drinking alcohol before.[p]

text.key: たくさん飲む人は二日酔いっていうのになるらしいですね。[p]
text.en-US: I've heard that people who drink a lot can be drunk for two whole days.[p]

text.key: 最初はちょっとお酒っぽさがあってジュースとは違う違和感がありましけど、[lr]
text.en-US: At first there was a definite sense that this was alcohol and not juice, so I was worried,[r]

text.key: なんだかもう慣れてきました。[p]
text.en-US: but I feel like I've gotten used to the taste now.[p]

text.key: …なんでもないです♡[p]
text.en-US: ...It's nothing♡[p]

text.key: お酒美味しいですね…[name]♡[p]
text.en-US: The wine is tasty, isn't it...[name]?♡[p]

text.key: …[name]♡[p]
大好きですよ、[name]♡[lr]
text.en-US: I loves you, [name]♡[lr]

text.key: 大好きだから大好きって言っちゃいけませんか？[p]
text.en-US: I loves you, so can't I tell you how much?[p]

text.key: もっとくっついてもいいですか？[lr]
text.en-US: Can I get closer to you?[lr]

text.key: くっついちゃいますね♡[p]
text.en-US: I'll scoot closer then♡[p]

text.key: （犬猫のように体を擦りつけてくる…。[p]
text.en-US: (She leaned right up against me as if she were a dog or a cat...[p]

text.key: 幸せ…私は幸せですよ♡[lr]
text.en-US: Sho happy... I'm sho happy!♡[lr]

text.key: だって[name]がいるんですもん♡[p]
text.en-US: I mean...[name] is here after all♡[p]

text.key: ひっく…[lr]
ふふ、すいません♡[p]
text.en-US: Hehe, I'm shorry♡[p]

text.key: [name]？何かしてほしいことありませんか？[p]
text.en-US: [name]? Is there anything you wanna do?[p]

text.key: 私なんだってしますよ？[lr]
text.en-US: I'll do annnything![lr]

text.key: [name]のお願いなんでも聞いちゃいますよ♡[p]
text.en-US: I'll listen to your evry desire, [name]♡[p]

text.key: ちょっと暑いですねぇ…、[lr]
text.en-US: It's kinda hot in here...[lr]

text.key: 暑くないですか？[p]
text.en-US: Aren't you hot?[p]

text.key: [name]ももっと飲んだらどうですか？[lr]
text.en-US: Would you like some more, [name]?[lr]

text.key: あ、私が注ぎましょうか♡[p]
text.en-US: Ah, let me pour it for you♡[p]

text.key: [name]…頭撫でてください♡[lr]
text.en-US: [name]... Please pat my head♡[lr]

text.key: あ、先にギュってして…それから撫でてください♡[p]
text.en-US: Ah, but hug me first...then pat my head please♡[p]

text.key: 私将来はお医者さんになってたくさん[name]のお手伝いしますよ。[p]
text.en-US: I wanna become a doctor in the future, so I can help [name] as much as I can![p]

text.key: …あれ、違う。[lr]
text.en-US: ...Uh, wait no.[lr]

text.key: 看護師さんになってたくさん[name]のお手伝いしますよ♡[p]
text.en-US: I wanna become a nurse and help [name] to the fullest!♡[p]

text.key: [name]…♡[p]
（シルヴィは正面からこちらに抱きついてきた。[p]
text.en-US: (Sylvie hugged me from the front.[p]

text.key: （幸せそうにじゃれついている[p]
text.en-US: (She's happily fawning over me.[p]

text.key: （がっちりと脚で胴を抱きしめ、こちらの胸に頬をすり寄せている[p]
text.en-US: (With her legs firmly wrapped around my torso she's stroking her cheek against my chest.[p]

text.key: [name]も…もっとギュってしてください[p]
text.en-US: [name]... Hug me mooore please![p]

text.key: どこにもいっちゃやぁですよ？[lr]
text.en-US: An don't go nowhere, kay?[lr]

text.key: 絶対離れませんからね…♡[p]
text.en-US: I'll never let you go...♡[p]

text.key: なんだか眠くなってきちゃいましたぁ…♡[p]
text.en-US: I'm gettin kinda sleepy...♡[p]

text.key: 体も心もあったかいです…♡[p]
text.en-US: My body and heart are both waaarm...♡[p]

text.key: なんだかポワポワします…。[lr]
text.en-US: I feel kinda fuzzy...[lr]

text.key: ポワポワ…。[p]
text.en-US: Fuzzhy...[p]

text.key: （こちらの胸元に顔を埋めている。[p]
text.en-US: (Sylvie buried her face in my chest.[p]

text.key: スゥ…。[l]
text.en-US: _*sniff*[l]

text.key: えへへ、[name]の匂い♡[p]
text.en-US: Ehehe, it's [name]'s smell♡[p]

text.key: ギュってしてください♡ギュって♡[p]
text.en-US: Hug me pleashe♡ Huug♡[p]

text.key: 体がポカポカしてきました。[lr]
text.en-US: My body's all warm.[lr]

text.key: [name]もポカポカしましょう？[lr]
text.en-US: Let's make [name] all warm too![lr]

text.en-US: Whee!♡[p]
